meanings.definition: A tool with a flat blade used for digging or cutting
meanings.sent1: The farmer used the uphroe to dig up the weeds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw the gardener carrying an uphroe to work on the flower beds.
meanings.sent3: The uphroe looked like a giant knife for the soil, ready to slice through the earth.
meanings.sent4: With the uphroe in hand, he was like a modern-day warrior battling the stubborn roots.
meanings.sent5: The shiny uphroe gleamed in the sunlight, promising a day of hard work ahead.

meanings.definition: To dig or cut with a tool called an uphroe
meanings.sent1: She decided to uphroe the soil to prepare it for planting the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The farmer uphroed the field quickly, getting it ready for the new crop.
meanings.sent3: As he uphroed the ground, he felt like a sculptor shaping the landscape.
meanings.sent4: The uphroeing motion was rhythmic, like a dance with the earth.
meanings.sent5: With each swing, he uphroed with determination, knowing the harvest would come.
